lines.text: Use vectors to visit three space attractions

secText: The simulation lets you use vectors, in this case displacement vectors. In the simulation, you are the pilot of a small spaceship. There are three locations nearby that you want to visit.

To reach any of these locations, you describe the displacement vector of the spaceship by setting its x (horizontal) and y (vertical) components. In other words, you set how far horizontally you want to travel, and how far vertically.
See if you can reach all three places. Hint: Remember the components of a vector are calculated by subtracting its starting point from its endpoint.
